abstract: Obama administration proposes Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights Act, which will establish baseline data-processing requirements for companies and is meant to give Americans more control over personal information collected by companies; analysts say bill is unlikely to pass in Republican Congress, and privacy advocates criticize bill for failing to go far enough.
lead_paragraph: Under the proposed legislation, called the Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights Act, industries would draw up their own codes of conduct on handling customer data, which regulators would enforce.

headline.main: White House Proposes Broad Consumer Data Privacy Bill
headline.print_headline: White House Proposes Broad Consumer Data Privacy Bill

snippet: Under the proposed legislation, called the Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights Act, industries would draw up their own codes of conduct on handling customer data, which regulators would enforce.
